content: 5 1 z i g z a g z i g z a g 2 17 17 16 16 15 15 14 14 13 13 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5 4 4 27 25 20 15 10 5 1 27 25 20 15 10 5 1 s n o w f l a k e s s n o w f l a k e s 2 17 17 16 16 15 15 14 14 13 13 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5 4 4 27 25 20 15 10 5 1 27 25 20 15 10 5 1 l i t t l e t r e e s d o t s & d a s h e s © copyright 2005 j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 3 h e e l s h a p i n g the heel is worked in 2 halves if you like you can use different coloured yarn for contrast the next row is slightly complicated so i ve broken it f i r s t h a l f down into steps row 18 with right side facing join contrast yarn k7 and turn leaving the remaining 18 stitches on row 32 with right side facing rejoin yarn a and begin the needle knitting across the 4 stitches of the heel fig 6 pick up and knit 5 stitches from the inside edge of heel row 19 slip 1 p6 figs 7 & 8 row 20-25 repeat row 18 & 19 three more times before knitting across the main part of the stocking until 8 row of heel have been worked pick up the left loop of the stitch below the first row of row 26 k3 k2tog k1 turn leaving 1 remaining stitch the heel fig 9 and knit this loop together with the of heel on needle first stitch from the left needle fig 10 this will help to ensure that you don t get a hole in the work at the row 27 slip 1 p4 point of the heel join row 28 k2 ssk turn leaving 2 stitches on needle row 29 slip 1 p2 knit 9 stitches across main part of stocking leaving 1 row 30 k2 ssk k1 turn stitch un-worked slip the next stitch across to the row 31 slip 1 p3 right needle pick up the right leg of the stitch below the first row of the heel pass this and the slipped leaving these 4 stitches on the needle with the main stitch back to the left needle and knit them together part of the stocking fig 4 turn the work so that the wrong side is facing and resume working the
